name: DELETE
description: Delete documents from an Elasticsearch index that match the WHERE clause. Uses the delete_by_query API internally. Without a WHERE clause, ALL documents will be deleted (use TRUNCATE for better performance).

clauses.name: WHERE
clauses.description: Filter condition to select documents to delete

examples.title: Delete by condition
examples.sql: DELETE FROM logs WHERE level = 'DEBUG' AND timestamp < '2024-01-01'

examples.title: Delete with complex condition
examples.sql:
DELETE FROM sessions
WHERE expired_at < CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
  OR (last_activity < DATE_SUB(CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, INTERVAL 1 HOUR) AND NOT persistent)

examples.title: Delete all (not recommended)
examples.description: Delete all documents - use TRUNCATE instead

notes: Without WHERE clause, all documents will be deleted
Use TRUNCATE TABLE for deleting all documents (more efficient)
Deletions are not atomic across multiple documents
